I need to consider Alice's new offer carefully. She's now offering me $425,000 (42.5%) while she gets $575,000 (57.5%).

She's right that our different inflation rates create an asymmetry, with her losing 20% per round compared to my 10%. We've already lost some value after 3 rounds - my potential gains are worth 19% less than round 1, and hers are worth 36% less.

If I reject and we continue to the next round, the money will depreciate further for both of us, and there's no guarantee we'll reach a better agreement. Alice has moved from her initial 60-40 split toward my proposed 50-50, showing willingness to compromise.
